ovdesc.p: The agent, front office or branch operations of Mutual Fund companies would receive applications for subscriptions, redemptions and fund switching. Subscriptions are performed when a customer decides to invest into a fund. Redemptions are performed when the customer wishes to sell some holdings. MF.ORDER.BY.CUST is a Pre-Order application which is used for introducing new subscribers to the fund and also handle subscription or redemption requests of existing clients. It will perform four functions: -

1. It will record details of customer order like the Fund ID, amount proposed to be invested or redeemed, payment mode (cheque, cash, switch, account debit, etc.), special order instructions like order type, expiry date, etc.
3. Record the details of plans that the customer would like to enter into – Systematic Investment Plans (SIP), Systematic Withdrawal Plan (SWP) or the Systematic Switching Plans (SSP).
4. Handle Fund Switches – Switch from one fund to other

Field to determine the purchase transaction towards which the redemption would be allocated. Input allowed only for Debit TRANS.TYPE (redemptions).

In case of redemptions, the same would be allocated towards the credit transaction specified. If the number of units in the Credit Transaction is more than the redemption amount, then units would be redeemed only to the extent of the redemption amount and balance units would remain. If the credit transaction units are not sufficient to cover the redemption amount, then the redemptions would be allocated towards the remaining Credit transactions on FIFO basis. If there are no other credit transactions, the redemption would only be executed to the extent of units available.
If the order in which units are to be redeemed is not provided here, the redemptions would be allocated on a FIFO basis. This field could be sub-valued to specify multiple credit transactions.

Defines the type of the plan. There could be three kinds of plans:

The plans need not necessarily be entered at the time of placing the order. They could be entered separately at a later date using this application.

The settlement account could also be provided in the order. For orders to a single fund, this would default from SEC.ACC.MASTER based on the order currency specified

In case of bulk subscriptions/redemptions, separate settlement accounts are provided as part of bulk multi-value set. Field to specify whether the order amount is inclusive or exclusive of all charges. This is valid only for cases where the order is in terms of amount (all subscriptions and few redemptions). If the FEE.INCLUSIVE is set to YES, the amount that the customer is willing to expend including all charges is the amount specified in ORDER.AMOUNT field. The order amount in that case would be adjusted for the charges and the unit calculation would be adjusted in such a way that the total settlement amount for the customer does not exceed the order amount. It must be noted that this calculation (fee calculation) would be based on current NAV prevailing in the system at this price. If the unit allocation has to be based on future NAV, then there could be some variation and the amount of settlement could be less than or more than the order amount specified.
This should be set to 'YES' if PAYMENT.MODE is not Account.

For e.g., one TRANS.TYPE could be used for initial subscriptions and one for subsequent subscriptions so that different fee structure could be applicable. Similarly, different TRANS.TYPE could be used for Switches so that fee structure for switches could be different (even within this category, further trans types could be used so as to levy different charges for different switches).

For example, if a customer holds 1000 units in a fund and AUTO.PERCENTAGE is set to 50, then 500 units would be redeemed. This would be done for all the funds in which customer has a holding.
